III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is concern with the professionalism exhibited by a staff
member towards a certain youth. The staff member is showing
favoritism towards one youth by allowing them to ride in the front
seat, giving the youth more snacks than others, and allowing the
youth to use their phone. This youth may have already been to the
staff members home as they are aware of the address. The youth
refers to the staff member in inappropriate terms and other staff
have made comments that the staff member and the youth will be
dating once the youth turns 18 years old. Administration is aware
of the comments and have not addressed it possibly due to
person/professional relationship boundary issues.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 28, 2025,
and reported when interviewing Staff 1 for a previous
investigation (2025SIC0000644), Staff 1 told her about the
information but reported it was “hearsay” and did not see
Staff 3 allow Youth A to sit in the front seat, provide extra
snacks, use his cell phone or take Youth A or any youths to
his house. Complainant reported when interviewing Youth D,
who was placed at the facility during the same time frame as
Youth A, Youth D denied there was any favoritism with any staff
toward any youths.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on June 2, 2025. Staff 1
reported she no longer works at the facility, stating she left on her
own accord. Staff 1 described hearing youth (could not recall
which youth) talk about Youth A being able to ride in the front seat
of the van when Staff 3 was driving the van. Staff 1 denied seeing
Youth A sit in the front seat during outings when Staff 3 was
driving the van. Staff 1 reported youth can sit where they want to
in the van unless there are male staff present, then youth are not
to sit next to the male staff. Staff 1 stated she heard Staff 3
bought Youth A a smoothie from the gas station when a different
2

youth had been asking for a smoothie and was told no. Staff 1
reported she did not know who the youth was that was told no
about getting a smoothie. Staff 1 described when snacks are
bought for the youth the snacks are all to be the same. Staff 1
reported she saw Staff 3 give Youth A his cell phone when Youth
A was sitting on the couch in the unit to listen to music. Staff 1
stated she could not recall when this occurred or who else was
present on the unit. Staff 1 stated she heard Staff 3 went to his
house multiple times during outings with youth present in the van
to pick up his dog or let his dog out of his house. Staff 3 reported
she did not see this occur and did not know when this took place.
Staff 3 stated she heard different youth talking about it “months
ago.” Staff 1 denied telling any supervisor or administrator about
her concerns with Staff 3. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 and Supervisor
2 were friends so Staff 1 did not think anything would happen to
Staff 3.
Director and Supervisor 1 were interviewed face to face,
separately at the facility on June 5, 2025. They both denied
being aware of any information in the allegations. Supervisor 1
stated if there was favoritism occurring by Staff 3 or any staff
member the youth would be talking about it and bringing it to
administration’s attention. Supervisor 1 reported there are not
assigned seats for youth when an outing occurs.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 5,
2025. Youth B reported youth are allowed to sit in the front seat in
the van when going on outings. Youth B stated there are not
assigned seats and youth can choose where to sit in the van.
Youth B described when snacks are provided everyone gets the
same snacks, including staff. Youth B stated Staff 3 has bought
snacks for youths and described the snacks as being the same for
every youth. Youth B denied seeing any youth get a better or
more desirable snack than any other youth. Youth B reported she
did not know of any incident where one youth received a
smoothie, and another youth was told no when asked for a
smoothie. Youth B stated staff cannot have their cell phones
during shift. Youth B reported that staff cell phones are to be
locked in the staff’s car or in the staff office. Youth B denied
seeing any youth on a staff member’s phone listening to music.
Youth B reported she has never been to any staff member’s
house. Youth B denied being aware of where any staff member
lives. Youth B stated she has never heard any youth at the facility
talk about going to a staff member’s house or knowing where any
staff member lives.
3

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 5,
2025. Youth C reported youth are able to sit where they choose in
the van. Youth C stated youth are allowed to sit in the front seat.
Youth C denied ever going to any staff member’s house during an
outing. Youth C reported she is not aware of where any staff
member lives. Youth C stated she has never heard of any youth
saying they have been to a staff member’s house or know where
any staff live. Youth C described staff not being able to have their
cell phone on them during shifts. Youth C reported she believes a
staff was using a cell phone one time when the staff’s radio died.
Youth C could not recall when this occurred or who the staff was.
Youth C stated snacks are not provided by the facility very often
but when they are everyone gets the same snack. Youth C
denied any youth getting different snacks or more desirable
snacks. Youth C stated staff treat all the youth the same at the
facility. Youth C denied having any concerns with staff.
Consultant interviewed Staff 4 face-to-face at the facility on
5/8/2025 and a follow up interview via telephone on 6/4/2025.
Staff 4 reported on the way to the park they stopped at the gas
station and Staff 3 ran to his house and got his dog. Staff 4
reported on the way back from the park he drove a few houses
away from Staff 3’s house so Staff 3 could take his dog back
home. Staff 4 reported he parked away from Staff 3’s house so
the youth would not know where Staff 3 lived.
Youth E was interviewed via Team on June 5, 2025. Youth E
reported when she was at the facility (Youth E is currently at a
different facility) youth were able to sit where they chose in the
van. Youth E stated youth could sit in the front seat. Youth E
denied going to any staff member’s house or knowing where any
staff member lived. Youth E described if snacks were provided by
staff all youth and staff received the same snack. Youth E
reported she could not recall any incidents staff allowed youth to
use their cell phones to listen to music. Youth E stated staff were
“okay” at the facility and reported she did not have any concerns.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on June 24, 2025.
Youth A reported she left the facility at the end of February
(February 26, 2025) and is currently in independent living. Youth
A denied going to Staff 3’s house or any staff member’s house.
Youth A reported she did not know where any staff member lived.
Youth A described youth being able to sit in the front seat or
whatever seat they choose in the van when going on an outing as
long as it was not next to a male staff member. Youth A denied
ever sitting in the front seat of the van. Youth A stated when
4

snacks were bought for youth everyone got the same snack or
sometimes a list of “general snacks” would be made and that was
what was bought for the group. Youth A denied getting different
snacks than other youth. Youth A reported that Staff 3 never
bought her a snack that was different than what other youth
received. Youth A stated she could not recall any staff allowing
youth to use their [staff’s] cell phone to listen to music. Youth A
denied Staff 3 proving his cell phone for her to listen to music.
Youth A reported it was “okay” at the facility, but she liked being
where she is now “a lot better.”
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff
2 reported he has never been on an outing when any staff went to
their house with youths in the facility van. Staff 2 denied ever
hearing any youth talk about going to a staff member’s house or
knowing where a staff member lives. Staff 2 stated he has never
seen a staff member give a youth their cell phone to listen to
music. Staff 2 described staff must lock their cell phone in the
office and are not allowed to have them during their shift. Staff 2
reported that when snacks are bought for youths every youth is
provided with the same snack. Staff 2 denied seeing any staff
member treat any youth better than the other youth or play
favorites.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 27, 2025. Staff
3 reported youth can sit where they choose in the facility van as
long as female youth are not sitting by male staff. Staff 3 stated if
he was driving the facility van, Youth A would not have been
allowed to sit in the front seat because a male staff was driving.
Staff 3 denied ever going to his house during an outing with any
youth. Staff 3 reported one time he had a staff member stop down
the road from his house so Staff 3 could run to his house and let
his dog out. Staff 3 stated the “youth would have really had to
strain their necks to see where he was going.” Staff 3 denied ever
allowing any youth to use his cell phone. Staff 3 reported staff
must lock up their cell phone and cannot have their cell phone
while working. Staff 3 reported that if snacks were bought for
youth, every youth was provided with the same snack. Staff 3
stated it may be a different flavored Gatorade, but all the youth
would a get Gatorade. Staff 3 described snacks having to be
approved by administration as the company card was used to buy
snacks. Staff 3 denied ever providing Youth A with different, more
desirable snacks than the other youth. Staff 3 described having a
good working relationship with Youth A. Staff 3 denied treating
Youth A any different than he treated the other youth.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 3’s personnel file. Staff 3 had one discipline dated
4/29/2025 for not following the facilities call in procedure
and received training on Employee Roles and
Responsibilities during orientation on 07/25/2023.
• Youth Opportunity Employee Handbook Security/Safety
Standards for Employees: While on duty no employee shall
bring into the facility any article that is not authorized by
written directive or prior authorization including cell phones.
Use of a personal cellular telephone during working hours
or on company premises is subject to restrictions and may
subject the employee to corrective action, up to and
including termination.
• Youth Opportunity Employee Handbook Youth-Staff
Boundaries: Staff are expected to exhibit and maintain
ethical and professional behavior. This includes interacting
with youth in a manner that promotes their emotional and
physical safety and incorporates trauma responsive
practices. Under no circumstance is an employee,
regardless of position, to do any of the following:
Demonstrate or exhibit special treatment to youth or give
gifts to youth as a special consideration. Employees are
not to disclose personal information.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, Staff 3 did not show favoritism toward Youth A or take
Youth A or any youths to Staff 3’s home.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
